article_title: Health care reform's 'Cadillac' excise tax complicating labor talks
article_text:
The health care reform law's so-called “Cadillac tax” on employer health plans doesn't take effect until 2018, but it already is complicating employer contract negotiations with unions.

Under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, a 40% excise tax will be imposed on premiums that, in 2018, exceed $10,200 for single coverage and $27,500 for family coverage.
